items.sentence: I was born in Boston, but I've lived most of my life in Chicago.
I wrote Tom a letter and asked him to come visit us this summer.
If you believe what politicians say, it's really your own fault.
I asked Tom to come with us, but he said that he didn't want to.
I know that you want me to help you, but I've been asked not to.
I thought it would be an uneventful weekend, but I was mistaken.
There's something mysterious about the way that Tom is behaving.
Tom wasn't trying to impress you. He was trying to impress Mary.
We'll have to compare notes and see what each of us has learned.
I don't know if I've ever told you, but you have beautiful eyes.
From the top of that tall building, you can easily see the city.
Live each day as if it were your last. Someday, you'll be right.
It doesn't matter all that much what college you graduated from.
All Mary's friends warned her that Tom was only after her money.
Tom found a bottle with a note inside it washed up on the beach.
After months of fighting, Tom and Mary decided to call it quits.
Tom doesn't know the difference between a fable and a fairytale.
The language course Tom designed is more confusing than helpful.
Tom was the only one who seemed to notice that Mary was missing.
Even a clock that is stopped shows the correct time twice a day.
